attributes.action: Stop the new INFRASTRUCTURE BILL.
attributes.background: This new bill will effectively privatize the Land Registry department. It means public land and asserts will now be In control of a private profit making company. This allow Fracking companies to set up in woodland, or parks, without public or council opposition.
attributes.additional_details: The government’s new Infrastructure Bill removes control for decisions to sell or develop publicly owned land from the public sector. In short, a private company will have the power to sell publicly owned land for Fracking, or whatever.The Infrastructure Bill has somehow managed to slip through to its Second Reading in the House of Lords from 1830 Wednesday 18th June 2014. The Bill contains a clause that will end local decision making over use of publicly owned land by councils or the public.

attributes.action: To help fund Menieres Disease, by researching treatments for sufferers.
attributes.background: Ménière's disease is a rare disorder that affects the inner ear. The disease of unknown cause affecting the membranous labyrinth of the ear, causing progressive deafness and attacks of tinnitus and vertigo. I am a 21 years old Ménière's sufferer and I would appreciate support in this worthy cause.
attributes.additional_details:
Ménière’s disease is a long term, progressive condition affecting the balance and hearing parts of the inner ear. Symptoms are acute attacks of vertigo (severe dizziness), fluctuating tinnitus, increasing deafness, and a feeling of pressure in the ear.
The disease can have a huge impact to everyday activities, social/work life. Unfortunately there is not a lot of awareness for Ménière’s disease and not of research is put into this due to funds, however I would like to change this for sufferers

attributes.action: Ban the practice of Halal and Kosher slaughter in the UK
attributes.background: This petition believes that there is no place for the barbaric process of inhumane slaughter of livestock on religious grounds. Animals reared for meat for human consumption deserve the methods of slaughter which cause the least amount of suffering possible.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid & use the money to increase the defence budget and armed forces
attributes.background:
We believe the the Government should reduce the Foreign Aid budget back to £8.4bn, the level it was at in 2010.
The Foreign Aid budget is set to rise to almost £16bn by 2020.
We believe this additional funding should be moved to beef up our defence capabilities and our marvellous armed forces.
attributes.additional_details:
The Foreign Aid budget is too high and is subject to abuse.
We believe that the budget should be reduced to £8.4bn & the commitment of a minimum of 2% GDP on defence spending is increased.
Our armed forces are amongst the best in the world.
We should reflect this by boosting our defence budget & spending on our armed forces.
In an ever more dangerous world, we should spend more on beefing up our defence budget.
We believe that the best way to achieve this is to cut Foreign Aid & boost Defence

attributes.action: Make DWP disability assessment providers supply video recording equipment.
attributes.background: Many people attending disability assessments have memory problems and cannot remember what was said and done during their face to face assessments. Providing a video recording of this assessment is a reasonable adjustment in the same way ramps are for wheelchair users and Braille is for the blind.
attributes.additional_details:
Additionally there seems to be a lot of corrupt assessors out there who are making a mockery of the system. As the only evidence that can prove an assessor lied is the recording of the assessment which they often refuse to allow it leaves the system in their favour. As we are often told if you are doing nothing wrong then you have nothing to hide. 

So should we record so the disabled person can remember or not record it so the assessor can lie.

attributes.action: All official campaign material for UK elections must be fact checked
attributes.background: We need to stop inaccurate or misleading information in official campaign materiel in elections and referendums (posters, leaflets posted to people, TV broadcasted, etc.). A neutral third party could be used to do this.
attributes.additional_details:
During the recent Brexit campaign, both slides used statistics that were widely regarded to be inaccurate - this needs to stop. 

In the past we could count on the media to do this, but it appears that we can no longer do this. 

We have official statistics and official and impartial organizations who publish statistics and perform fact checking these can be used.

attributes.action: Review the NHS111/Ambulance Service and ensure adequate governance/safeguarding.
attributes.background: In February 2015 our son, Harry Williams, died from Meningitis.  A catalogue of errors associated with the NHS 111 service including poor training and deliberate delays to ambulance response times, in order to achieve targets, caused significant distress and delayed treatment when he fell ill.
attributes.additional_details:
The Daily Telegraph revealed the findings of a draft “forensic review” of the matter, which said Mr Sutton pushed the policy through despite direct pleas to him from senior managers regarding the dangers.

The ambulance trust invented its own system to “stop the clock’” on thousands of calls, routinely downgrading the response to patients who came via 111. 
'This confirms our previous serious concerns about secretive decision-making and cover-up at SECamb.' Murphy - Patients Association.

attributes.action: Local Authority SEN Departments MUST be made accountable to statutory timescale.
attributes.background: This petition is to make Local Authority Special Educational Needs departments, accountable when failing to meet statutory guidelines, and those determined by Sendist. Local Authority's are currently not accountable when failing to meet those timescales, and this MUST change.
attributes.additional_details:
Having faced two SEN tribunals to date, I'm faced with another battle. 
The Local Authority SEN department procedures for issuing EHC plans, are governed by statutory guidelines, and also guidelines determined by Sendist Tribunal. 

However, Local Authority's are not held accountable for either timescales and as in my case exceed them by an excessive amount of time with no accountability. Local Authority's MUST be made legally accountable for unjust and unfair delays to securing SEN support.

attributes.action: Immediate force to combat  suicides in Veterans and Members of our Armed Forces
attributes.background: More Veterans and serving men and women killed them selves in 2012 than were lost during the Afghan war.
attributes.additional_details:
The facts speak for them selves. The deaths are continuing to rise and the government and parliament must make the forming of this force a priority .More Falkland veterans have killed them selves than were actually killed  during the Conflict in 1982.
We demand an immediate force of Veterans and professional people  be made into a new force which will be given priority, to help and stop our veterans and serving forces killing them selves.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid courses more accessible regarding location and cost
attributes.background: Mental Health First Aid courses teach how to identify the signs of key mental health issues, provide initial help and capably guide someone towards suitable support. Despite its benefits, many people haven't heard of MHFA; the course is not affordable for all (£300 per person) and centres are scarce
attributes.additional_details:
Mental ill health costs companies £26 billion and affects 25% of people, while the annual cost to the NHS is predicted to double over the next 20 years from £105 billion. With fast diagnosis and application of viable treatment, this could be alleviated.
Our NCS Social Action project (government scheme run by Catch 22) aims to increase MHFA accessibility, thus enhancing mental health care and awareness, developing community support by removing stigmas and advancing knowledge.
www.mhfaengland.org

attributes.action: Iain Duncan Smith MP: Give sick cancer patients access to financial support
attributes.background: The benefit rules should be relaxed for cancer patients who prove they are genuinely sick, regardless of their age, employment status and financial status.
attributes.additional_details: Cancer comes with huge costs. Not just physically and emotionally, but also financially. It robs people of their ability to work, their livelihoods and their savings. While cancer is classed as a disability in some aspects of law, it isn't classed as a disability when applying for benefits. Under the current government, cancer patients are being denied access to crucial financial support. That support needs to be made more accessible - because cancer is devastating enough.

attributes.action: Take into account the faith of Pakistani Christians when they claim asylum.
attributes.background: When considering Asylum applications from Pakistani Christians the Immigation Service should recognise that Pakistan is a dangerous place for Christians. To tell them simply to be Christian in secret is to misunderstand the Biblical command to gently and respectfully speak about Jesus Christ.
attributes.additional_details: This year's Easter Sunday bombing, targeted at Christians, is tragically just the latest in a long line of lynchings, church-bombings and house-burnings. In practice there is little or no protection of religious minorities by the authorities; perpetrators know they are more likely to be praised than prosecuted. See the list of atrocities on the Wikipedia page "Christianity in Pakistan". Search for Pakistan in the web pages of Barnabas Fund or Christian Solidarity Worldwide.

attributes.action: To change the Animal Welfare Act 2006
attributes.background:
We the undersigned would like to change the Animal Welfare Act 2006, making it a LIFE ban on any person found to be cruel to an animal.
At present it is only for some, most people only get 10 yrs. 
We feel that if a person abuses an animal once they WILL do it again at their first convenience!

attributes.action: Stop the proposed closure of Paignton and Brixham hospitals, Devon.
attributes.background: Torbay is struggling to cope as it is and it will be the elderly patients that will suffer further.

attributes.action: Restrict the sale of animals on the Internet.
attributes.background: I'm sick of finding out about and reading stories about poor, innocent animals sold on or given away on Gumtree and similar sites ending up as fighting dogs and bait etc. By restricting these sales, so many animals could be saved from horrific fates but I need YOUR help to make this happen!

attributes.action: Hold a General Election within the next six months.
attributes.background: Britain leaving the European Union fundamentally changes the UK political landscape and the terms on which UK Government policy is made. Political parties should present new manifestos appropriate to this new reality, and the electorate should have the chance to choose a new government.

attributes.action: Allow Hamde Abu Rahma, Palestinian photo journalist a visa to travel the UK.
attributes.background: Hamde Abu Rahma is a Palestinian photo journalist from Bil'in in the West Bank.  He has been refused for a second time a visa to come to the UK for the Edinburgh festival despite having financial backing.  He's been shot at, seen family killed and still remains peaceful.  He wants to tell his story.

attributes.action: Make a pensions treaty with South Korea for British people in Korea.
attributes.background: I have been working in Korea for nearly 10 years, and for nearly 8 of those years, I contributed over GBP10,000 to the nation pension scheme in South Korea. However, because there is no treaty for pensions between South Korea and the UK, I am unable to receive that money back in any way.
attributes.additional_details: I also have a number of friends who are in a similar predicament. If we contribute for 10 years to the scheme, we can get it when we are 65. But any less than that and we receive nothing. For me to receive any money at retirement, I would need to work in a private institute for 3 more years possibly, which for me is undesirable.
attributes.creator_name: Mr. James Michael Suddrey BA (Hons); MA

attributes.action: Call on the UK Government to urge the EU to increase tariffs on subsidised steel
attributes.background: The dumping of subsidised Chinese steel threatens the existence of the UK steel industry with, potentially, thousands becoming unemployed. This is not just a problem in the UK; cheap imports threaten steel making in the wider EU. We should call on the EU to impose higher tariffs on such imports.
attributes.additional_details: Due to State subsidies & overproduction, the Chinese steel industry has undercut EU steel by selling at prices which are lower than the production costs. This process has had the effect of depressing the whole market & jeopardising the future of steel making in the EU, including in the UK. Tata Steel, for example, has decided to sell all its UK plants citing cheap imports as a contributing factor. Any future steel production in the UK would face the same issue unless our government acts swiftly.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Remove all French words from the cover of new British passports.
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU means people voted to Take Back Control. Control of their borders, their culture and their language. Whether 'Dieu et mon droit' and 'Honi qui mal y pense' have existed as mottos in England for ages is irrelevant. French is an EU language and has no place on a UK passport.

attributes.action: Stop foreign men using marriage to live in the UK.
attributes.background: Marriage is a loophole in visa constraints. Abolishing the spouse visa would be for the common good, because England is over-crowded and the UK has more young men than young women. It would not prevent women from marrying foreign men because they can live in the husband's country, as is normal.
attributes.additional_details: This loophole for foreign men was closed in 1969 but was re-opened by the next Labour Home Secretary. The Conservatives promised to close the loophole again in their 1979 election manifesto, but did not keep their promise.

attributes.action: To ask Government for additional funding to postpone closure of UTC Lancashire
attributes.background: Parents and learners were told on the 03/05/2016 that UTC Lancashire would be closing on the 31/08/16. This will majorly impact on current learners from completing their GCSEs and A-levels in the summer of 2017. Please provide additional funding to postpone closure and to allow completion of exams.
attributes.additional_details: UTC Lancashire opened in Aug 2013-My son is flourishing in his subjects, he's hitting distinctions,despite never being a distinction pupil. He loves this learning environment and to have this taken away now half way through his GCSEs is so unfair.  The level of apprenticeship quality that is coming out of UTC is second to none. Learners are taught the skills, work ethic & given work experience to find employment.  The syllabus is so specialised no other secondary school can take on these pupils.

attributes.action: Assess both parents income when working out child maintenance
attributes.background: The new child maintenance service should take the receiving parents finances into consideration, to not put the paying parents family in poverty. The system at presents potentially can take from one child to give to another. Finances from both families should be assessed to make a fairer system.
attributes.additional_details:
The child maintenance does not take into consideration out going payments such as Rent and other financial obligations potentially putting a paying parents family at risk of being evicted. 
Maintenance should be based on individual cases. Currently the service does not take into account that the receiving parent could be with a high earner potentially putting another family in poverty. It also does not take into account an older child whom maintenance is being paid for is in part time work.

attributes.action: To make the A52, A15, A16, A17 in to dual carriage ways
attributes.background: The road systems in Lincolnshire have long been neglected resulting in unsafe potholes, faded road markings and an increase in road traffic collisions over the years. Due to the growth in population and industry the road in Lincolnshire simply cannot cope.
attributes.additional_details: By converting the four major roads throughout Lincolnshire into dual carrigeways this may potentially reduce traffic congestion within the main towns, decrease the risk of road incidents and encourage safer trade within the county. Within a year the A15 alone has seen an increase in road traffic fatalities due to an increase of vehicles on the roads - a dual carriageway on this particular road may make life easier for thriving agricultural and industrial businesses but it could also save lives.

attributes.action: Improve Testing for Lyme disease in UK and Treatment Guidelines
attributes.background: Lyme disease within the UK is a big problem and the NHS is refusing to recognize this, leaving many patients to spend thousands on private treatment or suffer in silence

attributes.action: Implement a UK-wide Deposit Return Scheme for recyclable drinks bottles
attributes.background: This petition calls for the UK government to implement an incentive based deposit return scheme to encourage the recycling of plastic and metal drinks bottles and cans. A well planned scheme in supermarkets will create employment while tackling the increase in coastal littering up 40% since 2014*
attributes.additional_details:
*The Marine Conservation Society recently reported that more than 8,000 bottles were picked up during its Great British Beach Clean Up in September, up 43% on 2014.

The MCS said putting a charge on the bottles of up to 20p, which gets refunded when they are returned and would change behaviour.

Successful schemes operate in several European countries where consumers can return specially marked bottles and cans to supermarket based facilities. 

http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-35878760

attributes.action: Allow Chris brown the artist back into the UK
attributes.background: Since the incident in 2009 when Chris brown wrongfully abused his ex girlfriend Rihanna, he was no longer allowed to enter England, almost 10 years later he still isn't able to visit our country. He has paid his debt to society and publically apologised. He has suffered enough. Bring back brown.

attributes.action: The law on WPA (widowed parents allowance) needs to be updated.
attributes.background: Currently those with children who are not married are not entitled to financial help with bereavement payments.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrimination of children from cohabiting couples rather than married ones is inconsistent with our human rights policy.
Please sign this petition to force the government to bring this benefit to all vulnerable families not only those with married parents.

attributes.action: British Parliment should not have a summer recess this year.
attributes.background: They should stay and work through the issues raised by BREXIT. This important to keep our economy stable throughout theses political changes .  Individuals should be able to take time off for family holidays, but for limited periods.

attributes.action: Provide group b streptococcus leaflets with all pregnancy packs
attributes.background: Group b streptococcus  (GBS) is a normal bacterium which colonises between 20-30% of women lethel to a newborn baby when in labour if not detected and passed on from mother to a baby with a average of 80 deaths a year and long term disabilitys most though no awareness
attributes.additional_details: UK currently don't routine test for gbs and no information is giving out from health care teams I believe by putting 1 leaflet in every pregnancy pack it will definitely be read by the mother giving her a choice to test for infection privately to protect her baby awareness of this infection is extremely important

attributes.action: Ensure Knowsley students have the opportunity to take A-Levels
attributes.background: No school in the entire borough of Knowsley offers A-Levels, which are often required for top universities or courses such as Medicine, limiting opportunities for children in Knowsley. Most schools in the borough are academies, so change requires direct intervention by the Department of Education.
attributes.additional_details: The last school to offer A Levels in Knowsley, Halewood Academy, announced in April that they would not be offering A-Levels in the coming year. Knowsley is one of the most deprived boroughs in the country, and many families cannot afford to send children out of the borough to schools or sixth forms that offer A-Levels. This effectively bars children from going to top universities and studying certain subjects which require A-Levels, harming social mobility and hampering the dreams of many.

attributes.action: Introduce a Brain Aneurysm Awareness month to help save lives.
attributes.background: Approximately 1 in 50 people unknowingly have a brain aneurysm as most are only discovered if they rupture. This leads to an extremely dangerous condition known as a subarachnoid haemorrhage which can cause extensive brain damage. Help us raise awareness by signing. Know the facts, save a life!
attributes.additional_details:
NHS Facts
Approx 3 out of 5 people who suffer from a SAH die within 2 weeks. Half of those who survive are usually left with brain damage or disability.

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Aneurysm/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Request the government to press the Bangladeshi government to free Shafik Rehman
attributes.background:
Shafik Rehman, 81 has been arrested for conspiring to kill the son of the Bangladesh Prime Minister. This government have arrested several journalists on trumped up charges but never as serious or as incredible as this one. 

He is being held on remand for interrogation by the Secret Service.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Rehman, a British citizen,  has been a proponent of democracy throughout his life and to that end has written strongly against past dictators and this current government who were elected unopposed when the main opposition refused to stand in the previous election.

He is the person who introduced Valentines Day to Bangladesh, wrote a book against Capital Punishment and his investigative journalism has changed the course of Bangladesh's history.

He is a man of peace with a powerful pen.

attributes.action: UK to offer free trade deals with any EU country that votes out in a referendum
attributes.background: With the EU starting to fall apart now is the time for the UK Government to offer the EU countries who are about to hold their own In/Out referendums the help and understanding they deserve by offering them a open trade deal with Great Britain if they vote for an exit.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition will have the effect of showing the world we are standing on our own two feet and ready to trade as normal with everybody who is free to trade with us, without the shackles of corrupt trade dictatorships.
It will also send a strong message to those silly billies who want a second referendum, a vote in parliament etc, and continue, in the face of our improving prospects to still continue to run down the UK in order to satisfy their own power aspirations and personal gain.

attributes.action: Extend paid maternity leave for mums who have premature babies in hospital.
attributes.background: After having a premature baby at 26+1 gestation and having spent 13 weeks in hospital. That's a third of my maternity leave used without having my baby home. Many other mums have the same problem not being able to take the unpaid leave due to not being able to afford it.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that if you have a baby more than 10 weeks early that has a long hospital stay, you should be able to apply for extended maternity pay and not start your official maternity leave till your baby is home so that you get the same privilege as a mum who has a full term baby with 9months paid at home with your child.

attributes.action: Stop Britain from being subjected to all new EU regulations and treaty changes.
attributes.background: The British people democratically decided to leave the EU.  The government could have revoked the European Communities Act 1972 and left straight away.  However it has decided to use the much slower European Union Article 50 route.  It now makes no sense at all to be bound by any new EU legislation.
attributes.additional_details: At this point in time the EU Commission could rush through all manner of legislation to frustrate Britain's amicable exit from Europe.  They could at a stroke of a pen extend the time covered by Article 50 from two years to five or more.  They could bring in treaty change legislation to literally milk our country for all the money they can get before we leave.  This petition is designed to encourage our government politicians to seriously consider this eventuality and prevent it from happening.

attributes.action: Include ADHD in the Disability Living Allowance SMI Criteria.
attributes.background: Make ADHD automatically an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain for Disability Living Allowance (Severe Mental Impairement Rules). Autism Spectrum Disorder is now automatically accepted as an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain, and ADHD should be too.
attributes.additional_details: ADHD comes little danger awareness and it is extremely hard to bring up a child who does not understand anything about danger, this means they need more help when out and about. To pass the severe mental impairment part of DLA you need to have an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain. ADHD is exactly that however, it is not automatically classed as that. I feel like this condition is too overlooked and we are still stuck in the dark ages regarding our views on it.

attributes.action: To make trespass a criminal offence.
attributes.background: To make trespass a criminal offence, to prevent travellers and others, setting up illegal sites. To prevent the illegal use of private and common land, which also brings with it the problems of illegal waste and unsanitary conditions.

attributes.action: Any member of her majesty's armed forces to be the highest priority for housing
attributes.background: Our service personnel are the providers of the freedoms we enjoy. We owe them everything.  It's time we started delivering. We the undersigned demand that upon any form of honourable discharge, all veterans must be placed at the top of the list for social housing, in the area of their choosing.
attributes.additional_details: We have been failing veterans for far too long. Time to put that right.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a business or service provider to ban guide dogs.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence for taxis or private hire drivers to refuse to carry guide or assistance dogs, unless they hold an exemption. This petition calls for parity so the same applies to businesses and service providers. We also call for police to be the prosecuting authority via magistrates court
attributes.additional_details: Currently, unlike for taxis and private hire cars, the law doesn't specifically say guide and assistance dogs must be admitted. This is wrong and leads to confusion. Moreover, other than for taxis. Matters are dealt with personally by the victim, at their cost via the county court. This is not the case for other types of discrimination. We call for a prosecuting authority to take the cases on, on behalf of the Crown.

attributes.action: Parliament to save the UK from breaking up by rejecting the EU referendum vote
attributes.background: The result was too close for such a major constitutional change and the consequences are far greater than people imagined.  The generation it will most affect were not all represented. 16 - 18 year olds voted in the Scottish referendum but why not in the EU referendum?

attributes.action: Increase university loans for art based courses.
attributes.background: Studying at university is an incredibly expensive thing to choose to do, however the added cost of buying materials and printing work for those on art-based courses means that, without extra help from family and carers, it's virtually impossible.
attributes.additional_details:
I spend hundreds of pounds a year to ensure my work is up to standard. This is not what university is about.
Your grade should not be based on how much you are able to spend on modelling materials and printing, but your actual skills.
I would like to see the student loan company take the cost of a course into account when deciding loan amounts.

attributes.action: To fund research for hidradenitis suppurativa  (HS) to get the knowledge to GP's
attributes.background: I have HS as do many of us here in the UK. HS is a painful skin disease thats courses boil like abscesses that affect the armpit, breast, groin and pubic area. It can effect people mentally as well as physically, like many ive had time of work due to the pain and after having surgery.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered with this diseases for the past 5 to 6 year and havent got any closer to any kind of relief from the pain the past year i have had 4 operations and now the surgeon's will not see me until i have seen the dermatologist, its a daily battle with my pain. Im not the only one that suffers on a daily basis with the pain and embarrassment of this dreadful disease. We need to see more support for people suffering and GP's and other professionals getting the knowledge to help us.

attributes.action: Publish the identity of aircraft used to bomb hospitals in Syria
attributes.background:
On 29 July, unidentified aircraft bombed a maternity hospital in Syria supported by Save the Children.

As part of the Coalition against Daesh, the UK has data on military aircraft flights in Syria. Where data can identify aircraft used to bomb hospitals, the UK should publish their identity.
attributes.additional_details:
Physicians for Human Rights have documented 373 attacks on medical facilities in Syria.

Deliberate attacks on hospitals are a war crime. Those responsible should not be allowed any measure of deniability.

Background: https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/07/syria-fatal-airstrike-on-maternity-hospital-a-potential-war-crime/

attributes.action: Change regulations for fathers who lose a child to stillbirth or neonatal death
attributes.background: Currently if a fathers child dies due to stillbirth or neonatal death they are only entitled to what their employer feels is required in terms of compassionate leave.  While a mother is fully entitled and rightly so to the full maternity leave.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the father should be entitled to take and or share the maternity leave with his partner. These are extreme circumstances and should be looked at as such. When it comes to dealing with the death of a child, your gender does not come in to it. I am writing from personal experience as my son Zachary was stillborn at 11 days overdue on April 2nd 2013.
I was treated extremely badly and inappropriately by my employer after having sick leave due to the death if my son.

attributes.action: Change the law, to set minimum prison sentences for those who abuse animals
attributes.background: The government should change the laws to set minimal prison sentences and life long bans for people convicted of animal abuse. These poor excuses of humans should be punished for their crimes rather than a 5 year ban for owning animals. Animals don't have a voice. Please be their voice and help them

attributes.action: Set a suitable, maximum waiting time for access to NHS mental health treatments
attributes.background: This petition forms the basis of the Campaign for Proper Mental Healthcare (https://propermentalhealthcare.com). The NHS is failing people with mental health problems. Waitings lists up to nearly a year and impersonal, generic assessments are not an appropriate treatment. The system needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: The Campaign for Proper Mental Healthcare is a website designed to share people's personal experiences with mental health services and treatments on the NHS. People are not getting the treatment they desperately need, leading to further feelings of helplessness and desperation. The system is not conducive to helping people effectively deal with and overcome depression, anxiety, or other mental health problems. A maximum waiting time of a matter of weeks would greatly improve this situation.

attributes.action: Introduce new traffic legislation to benefit motorbikes and emergency services.
attributes.background: Make it law that road users must move to the nearside in a traffic jam or when the traffic is stationery/slow moving, on multi lanes inner lanes move to the nearside and the outer lane move to the offside.   Allowing motorbikes and emergency services to filter/continue without risk of accident.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a motorbike rider of many years with an advanced riding certificate and a member of Blood bike Wales.  With more traffic users on the roads each year.  I find there to be the downturn/deterioration of courtesy and common sense within road users, more and more road users do not give way and sadly selfishly blocks the way of motorbike users during slow moving or stationary traffic.  

This would  increase safe passage for motorbikes and emergency services without affecting the road user!

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Poland syndrome and provide more info to those affected.
attributes.background: With our personal experience when we found out our son had Poland syndrome we found it really hard to get any information on this and also very few doctors have even heard of Poland syndrome. We feel after to speaking to others in the same position that there should be more info for us.
attributes.additional_details: Poland syndrome is a rare birth defect characterized by underdevelopment or absence of the chest pectoralis muscle and webbing of the fingers. In most individuals the missing part is the large Pectoralis muscle that attaches to the upper arm on one side and the breastbone. Abnormalities may affect muscles in the chest wall, side and shoulder and also rib cage abnormalities, Breast and nipple abnormalities may occur, may also affect internal organs.
